Name: Ashgabat
Description: Ashgabat (Turkmen: Aşgabat, also Ashkabat, Ashkhabad, Ashgabad, etc.) is the capital of Turkmenistan, surrounded by Ahal Province.

Name: Balkanabat
Description: Balkanabat is a city in Balkan Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Daşoguz
Description: Daşoguz is a city in Dashoguz Province, Turkmenistan near the Uzbek border.

Name: Mary
Description: Mary  is a city in Mary Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Türkmenabat
Description: Türkmenabat is a city in Lebap Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Turkmenbashi
Description: Turkmenbashi, formerly known as Krasnovodsk, is in Balkan Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Karakum
Description: The Karakum (Black Sand) Desert is a large, mostly empty desert that takes up most of the central section of Turkmenistan. It is famous chiefly for one destination, the Derweze Gas Crater, also popularly known as the Door to Hell, an open pit lake of fire that has been burning for more than 40 years now.

Name: Altin Depe
Description: Altin Depe is an archaeological site in Ahal Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Anau
Description: Anau (Anew) is a city in Ahal Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Gonur Depe
Description: Gonur Depe, or Gunar Tepe, is a city in Mary Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Jeitun
Description: Ashgabat (Turkmen: Aşgabat, also Ashkabat, Ashkhabad, Ashgabad, etc.) is the capital of Turkmenistan, surrounded by Ahal Province.

Name: Merv
Description: Merv is an old city on the Silk Road in the Mary Province of Turkmenistan.  There is a state park for the old city center, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: Nissa
Description: Nissa is an archaeological site in Ahal Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Geok-tepe
Description: Geok-tepe is a city in Ahal Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Konye Urgench
Description: Konye Urgench is a city in Dashoguz Province, Turkmenistan.

Name: Kugitang Nature Reserve
Description: Kugitang Nature Reserve is in Lebap Province, Turkmenistan, near Kerki.
